Data: Tuffey to Watson, 1 run back of a length outside leg stump, Watson's already backed away, in hopes of whacking one over cover, and has to adjust to nudge it around the corner for one
Tuffey to Hayden, no run shortish length outside off stump, Hayden's coming forward and has to adjust to steer it to backward point
Tuffey to Hayden, no run good length delivery on off stump, a tad slower perhaps, and Hayden defends solidly off the front foot
Tuffey to Hayden, 1 run good length on off stump again but this time he pushes with soft hands to mid-off and picks up a single to get Watson on strike
Tuffey to Watson, no run good length just outside off stump, he comes forward and flicks to midwicket
Tuffey to Watson, FOUR runs bang, thats four! The slower one is just overpitched enough for Watson to free the front leg and smash that down the ground cleanly
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run not the best ball to begin with, down leg stump and Hayden clips past square leg for the single
Gillespie to Watson, no run fuller outside off stump, but Watson watches it carefully into McCullum's gloves
Gillespie to Watson, FOUR runs short and wide, he rocks back and places that nicely in the gap between cover and point for another boundary
Gillespie to Watson, FOUR runs short and wide again, not the way to bowl in the PowerPlays, and Watson gets right over it, cutting superbly backward of point for another four
Gillespie to Watson, no run again he drops short but is lucky to get away with it, as Watson's checked backfoot drive doesnt beat cover

Gillespie to Watson, FOUR runs lands this one fuller and wider and Watson goes through with the flashy backfoot drive, as he knew there was no slip, and the ball races away off the thick edge for four more
Patel to Hayden, 1 run flat down the leg side and Hayden stands tall to punch into midwicket for one
Patel to Watson, no run tossed up outside off stump, Watson comes forward and defends back to Patel
Patel to Watson, 1 run flatter trajectory, he shuffles across and taps it in front of square leg for one
Patel to Hayden, no run quicker one, on middle and leg, and Hayden jams the bat down on it
Patel to Hayden, 1 run drifts down leg stump and he clips it past short fine leg for one
Patel to Watson, 1 run flat outside off stump, Watson comes forward and makes it fuller to drive to mid-on for one more
Gillespie to Watson, no run overpitched outside off stump, he comes to the pitch and drives to mid-off
Gillespie to Watson, 1 run outside off stump and its steered down to third man

Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run back of a length outside off stump, no room to cut but he does so anyways, cramped for it, and gets an inside-edge near off stump, Watson wants the single and gets it, well run
Gillespie to Watson, FOUR runs full outside off stump, Watson looks to get forward but adjusts and square-drives that excellently in the gap at point for four, lovely to watch!
Gillespie to Watson, 1 run slower ball on a good length, he waits for it and then opens the face to steer it past backward point
Gillespie to Hayden, no run quicker on a good length outside off stump, Hayden covers off stump and leaves it be
Styris to Watson, no run back of a length outside off stump, Watson stands and defends to point
Styris to Watson, 1 run back of a length on middle and off, Watson rolls the wrists over it, placing it wide of square leg and calling for the single
Styris to Hayden, no run good length outside off stump, good line, Hayden comes forward and drives to cover
Styris to Hayden, 1 run shorter this time, he comes forward and drives out to long-off for one

Styris to Watson, FOUR runs he gives himself some room to hit it offside, Styris follows him by bowling it down leg, Watson has to adjust to play it leg side and a misfield at short fine leg gives up the boundary
Styris to Watson, 1 run back of a length outside off stump, he runs it off the face of the bat for one down to third man
Gillespie to Watson, 1 run back of a length outside off stump, Watson opens the face to squirt that through gully out to Tuffey on the run from third man
Gillespie to Hayden, no run back of a length around off stump, Hayden comes forward and then has to defend back to Gillespie
Gillespie to Hayden, no run good length just outside off stump, he comes forward again and checks the drive
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run strays down leg stump and Hayden clips into midwicket for one
Gillespie to Watson, no run overpitched just outside off stump and he drives back to Gillespie, who jumps up and collects with his right hand
Gillespie to Watson, 1 run short and wide, he cuts and gets un under-edge past McCullum to bring up his 50, well played
Styris to Watson, no run quick, on a length outside off stump, Watson runs it to point
Styris to Watson, no run back of a length outside off stump, driven to cover
Styris to Watson, 1 run back of a length again, this time he drives back down past the stumps to long-off for one
Styris to Hayden, 1 run overpitched outside off stump and Hayden leans into a drive to mid-off for another easy single
Styris to Watson, 1 run drifts down leg stump, Watson plays it softly around the corner to short fine leg for one
Styris to Hayden, 1 run good length outside off stump, he opens the face and places it past a diving Vincent at backward point for one
Gillespie to Hayden, no run overpitched on off stump, he drives back to Gillespie who then throws back over the stumps to McCullum
Gillespie to Hayden, no run full again, he drives with an inside-edge to mid-on
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run overpitched in the same spot again, and this time his drive hits the stumps at the other end and forces the umpire to take evasive action
Gillespie to Watson, 1 run short outside off stump, Watson pulls hard through square leg out to the man on the ropes, on the bounce
Gillespie to Hayden, 2 runs back of a length on leg stump, up goes Hayden, working it past mid-on and calling for two immediately
Gillespie to Hayden, no run yorker-length ball outside off stump goes past his bat and McCullum collects
Styris to Watson, no run back of a length on off stump, driven to mid-on
Styris to Watson, 1 run fuller this time and he drives to mid-on, but gets the quick single this time
Styris to Hayden, 1 run back of a length outside off stump, he shuffles and rolls the wrists over it, placing it wide of McMillan at square leg
Styris to Watson, 1 run overpitched on off stump, Watson comes forward and chips it in the air but safely past mid-on out to a wide long-on
Styris to Hayden, no run movement outside off stump, steered to backward point
Styris to Hayden, no run good length outside off stump, Hayden stands and fishes at it and gets beaten, McCullum whips off the bails
Patel to Watson, 1 run flat outside off stump, Watson rocks back and cuts past point out to the sweeper
Patel to Hayden, no run tossed up outside off stump, he comes forward and defends
Patel to Hayden, no run fired in on leg stump, he flicks to mid-on
Patel to Hayden, no run flat and speared into middle and leg, Hayden defends back to Patel
Patel to Hayden, no run tossed up on off stump, he steers that to point
Patel to Hayden, no run tossed up on middle and leg, Hayden drives to midwicket and sets off for the run, Vincent moves in and fires in a throw and Hayden gets back into his crease
Styris to Watson, 1 run good length on the stumps, he stands and works that to midwicket
Styris to Hayden, no run good length outside off stump, he leans into a drive to cover
Styris to Hayden, 1 run width offered, he cuts late, and hard, in the gap behind square for one
Styris to Watson, 1 run good length on off stump, he comes onto the front foot and flicks into midwicket to bring up the 100
Styris to Hayden, no run width offered again, but this time Hayden cant time his cut past Vincent
Styris to Hayden, 1 run dropped short outside off stump, Hayden rocks back and pulls along the ground through midwicket
Patel to Hayden, 1 run tossed up outside off stump, he comes forward and squeezes that into the covers for one
Patel to Watson, no run flatter one this time, Watson shuffles well across and flicks to Taylor at midwicket, and sends back an eager Hayden
Patel to Watson, no run tossed up outside off stump, Watson uses the feet to meet the ball and drive to cover
Patel to Watson, 1 run flatter on middle and leg, he uses the feet again and flicks into midwicket
Patel to Hayden, no run spins into him and leaves, squaring him up as he looks to work it to leg and the ball rolls to point
Patel to Hayden, 1 run tossed up on middle and leg, worked past mid-on for the single
Styris to Hayden, 1 run good length on the stumps, driven down to long-on for one

Styris to Watson, 1 run close! Slower ball from Sytris on a good length, Watson comes forward and stops the shot, the ball goes up in the air and lands safely in front of Tuffey between mid-off and mid-on
Styris to Hayden, no run width offered and Hayden cuts to backward point
Styris to Hayden, no run good length ball on the stumps, he drives back to Styris
Styris to Hayden, no run full and wide, he gets onto one knee and really reaches for it, driving to cover
Styris to Hayden, 1 run good length outside off stump, Hayden uses the feet to meet it and drives to mid-off
Patel to Hayden, 1 run tossed up on leg stump, Hayden works it to Vincent at midwicket and set off, and Watson gets home by an inch as a good throw comes in
Patel to Watson, FOUR runs comes down the track, using his feet well, and slams it down the ground for four
Patel to Watson, 1 run spinning away outside off stump, Watson steers that wide of point for one more
Patel to Hayden, no run comes down the track, Patel fires it in quicker and flatter, and Hayden has to work it to midwicket
Patel to Hayden, no run tossed up again, Hayden comes down and drives back to Patel, who collects and has a shy back at Hayden
Patel to Hayden, 1 run flat outside off stump, chipped into the mid-off region for one to keep strike
Styris to Hayden, 1 run full outside off stump, Hayden gets down on one knee and square-drives out to the sweeper for one, and thats his 50
Styris to Watson, 1 run good length on off stump, Watson gets over it and drives down to long-on for one
Styris to Hayden, 2 runs back of a length outside off stump, he works that wide of midwicket for two, well run
Styris to Hayden, 1 run good length outside off stump, driven out into the deep
Styris to Watson, no run short of a length outside off stump, he stands tall and whips that to midwicket
Styris to Watson, 1 run fuller on the stumps, he gets well over it and flicks past short fine leg for one more
Patel to Watson, no run full outside off stump, he comes forward and flicks to midwicket
Patel to Watson, 1 run drifts onto middle and leg and Watson works it backward of square for the single
Patel to Hayden, 1 run tossed up on off stump, Hayden gets down and sweeps hard through square leg

Patel to Watson, OUT he's got him! Quicker and flatter, doesnt turn as Watson goes back, looking to play it square, and catches him in front of middle and leg, and umpire Baxter lifts the finger as bowler and 'keeper appeal
Patel to Haddin, no run fired in quickly on off stump, Haddin plays it back to Patel
Patel to Haddin, no run tossed up outside off stump, he reaches for it and drives to mid-off
Franklin to Hayden, no run good length outside off stump, Hayden rocks back and cuts to backward point
Franklin to Hayden, no run short again, this time he cuts harder but cant beat point
Franklin to Hayden, no run quicker and fuller, Hayden jams the bat down with no foot movement and for the third ball in a row finds Vincent
Franklin to Hayden, 1 run now he's getting impatient! Makes room to cut a goodlength delivery outside off stump and very nearly chops onto off stump
Franklin to Haddin, no run back of a length just outside off stump, Haddin stands up and defends in front of point
Franklin to Haddin, no run fuller outside off stump, Haddin drives nicely to mid-off but cant beat the man there
Patel to Hayden, no run tossed up, Hayden comes forward and gets beaten in the flight and has to adjust
Patel to Hayden, no run tossed up again, he comes forward and defends

Patel to Hayden, SIX runs bang, thats half a dozen! Patel tosses it up invitingly, Hayden uses the feet nicely to come down and pick it up off a length, and send it rows back over long-off, god way to break the shackles
Patel to Hayden, 1 run tossed up down leg side, Hayden goes on the backfoot and turns it to square leg
Patel to Haddin, no run tossed up on the stumps, Haddin comes on the frontfoot and defends it solidly
Patel to Haddin, 1 run fired into middle and leg, Haddin drives down to long-on to open his account
Franklin to Haddin, no run slower ball outside off stump, Haddin leans into it and drives to cover
Franklin to Haddin, no run well wide of off stump, and full, Haddin reaches for it and steers it to backward point
Franklin to Haddin, 1 run back of a length on leg stump, Hadding shuffles and flicks into midwicket for one
Franklin to Hayden, no run good length on middle and off, he looks to flick, getting a long way down the track, but isnt in control of that shot
Franklin to Hayden, no run short of a length outside off stump, Hayden makes room to cut and gets an inside-edge back past leg stump
Franklin to Hayden, 1 run short and wide, this time he times the cut nicely and gets one out to the sweeper
McMillan to Hayden, FOUR runs hello! Hayden heard Mick, is it! He slams a halfvolley from McMillan straight back down the ground for four
McMillan to Hayden, 2 runs good length on the legs, worked past midwicket for a couple
McMillan to Hayden, no run dropped! Hayden slams this very hard back to McMillan, who takes it smack in the stomach but cant hold onto it
McMillan to Hayden, 1 run good length outside off stump, he leans into it and drives past mid-off
McMillan to Haddin, 1 run slower on on the legs, Hadding clips to mid-on for one more
McMillan to Hayden, 1 run fullish on the legs, clipped past midwicket for one and he will retain strike
Franklin to Hayden, no run good length outside off stump and a leaden-footed Hayden swings the kitchen sink at it, but that was nuttin' but air
Franklin to Hayden, 1 run straighter one on the stumps, he drives down to mid-on for one
Franklin to Haddin, 2 runs overpitched outside off stump, Haddin strokes that smack down the ground and McMillan covers good ground at long-on and stops it on the ropes
Franklin to Haddin, no run short of a length outside off stump, he has a swing at it and gets an inside-edge onto the thighs
Franklin to Haddin, no run good length outside off stump, he leans into a drive and squeezes it to mid-off
Franklin to Haddin, no run good length outside off stump, Haddin opens the face of the bat and looks to run it down
McMillan to Hayden, SIX runs six more! Hayden gives himself room outside leg stump and has a full swing off the arms, and tees-off for maximum over long-off
McMillan to Hayden, 1 run overpitched outside off stump, he heaves it again but mistimes the drive back past McMillan
McMillan to Haddin, FOUR runs now Haddin wakes up, getting down on one knee and heaves across the line, finding the gap at deep backward square leg and thats four
McMillan to Haddin, 2 runs good length outside the off stump, he comes forward and drives past mid-off for two
McMillan to Haddin, SIX runs whoof! Shot! Halfvolley outside off stump, Haddin just disdainfully heaves that off one knee for a dinger over wide long-on
McMillan to Haddin, no run beaten! Quicker one outside off stump, comes in as Haddin flirts at it and McCullum whips off the bails
Franklin to Hayden, 2 runs fullish on middle and leg, whipped to square leg for two
Franklin to Hayden, 2 runs fullish on middle and off, Hayden drives back past the stumps and McMillan does well on the ropes to save two runs
Franklin to Hayden, 1 run short of a length outside off, Hayden goes on the backfoot and cuts it to deep backward point
Franklin to Haddin, 1 run back of a length on middle and leg, Haddin works it to deep midwicket for one
Franklin to Hayden, no run good length outside off stump, Hayden opens the face of the bat and steers it to point
Franklin to Hayden, no run good length delivery, Hayden goes back in defense
Gillespie to Haddin, FOUR runs and he begins with a full toss outside off stump, which Haddin creams to the long-off fence for four
Gillespie to Haddin, 1 run overpitched this time, Hadding leans into it and drives, cover gets a hand to it and parries it towards mid-off
Gillespie to Hayden, no run good length on middle and off, Hayden works it straight to mid-on
Gillespie to Hayden, no run good ball! Fires in the spot-on yorker and Hayden does well to jam the bat down in the nick of time, well bowled, sir
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run this time the yorker becomes a full toss that Hayden tamely drives to mid-off
Gillespie to Haddin, 2 runs another full toss, which Haddin drives past Gillespie for a brace out to Patel at long-off
Franklin to Hayden, FOUR runs full outside off stump, Hayden exposes the stumps and swings at it, and the result is a genuine french-cut past leg stump for four
Franklin to Hayden, 2 runs straighter one, and for what seems like the umpteenth time a Hayden drive hits the nonstrikers stumps and ricochets for run, and now he's into the nineties
Franklin to Hayden, no run good length outside off stump, he defends into the covers
Franklin to Hayden, no run full outside off stump, down on one knee he goes, square-driving right to a diving Vincent at point
Franklin to Hayden, no run back of a length outside off stump, Hayden plans the front leg forward and checks a tame drive back to Franklin, who's bowled a fine spell here
Franklin to Hayden, no run half-volley outside off stump, Hayden eases into a good-looking drive to Taylor back on the circle, but doesnt run the single
Gillespie to Haddin, FOUR runs full just outside off stump, Haddin opens the leg and slams it straight down the ground for four, well struck
Gillespie to Haddin, 1 run full toss on off stump, he makes room and drives past the covers out to the sweeper in the deep
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run well bowled, full in the slot, Hayden rolls the wrists over it and flicks into square leg
Gillespie to Haddin, 1 run full again, no room on offer, Haddin backs away to leg and squirts this into the covers for the single

Gillespie to Hayden, (no ball) full toss! Its outside off stump, well above the waist so its a no-ball, but Hayden's taken by surprise, and heaves across the line, the ball lands in front of Patel at mid-on
Gillespie to Hayden, FOUR runs another full toss, down leg, and Hayden helps it on its way to fine leg, well done
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run good length on middle and off, driven wide of mid-on to keep strike next over
Tuffey to Hayden, 1 run good length ball on middle and leg, worked into mid-on for one and he moves to 98
Tuffey to Haddin, 1 run good ball! Slower on in the blockhole, a good yorker, but Haddin digs it out and pinches the run, good stuff all round
Tuffey to Hayden, 1 run another yorker length delivery on the stumps, Hayden gets over it and works it into midwicket and he's onto 99
Tuffey to Haddin, 1 run full outside off stump, Haddin shuffles across the stumps and then has to jam the bat down it, steering it to backward point

Tuffey to Hayden, no run full on the legs, he works it to square leg and sets off, Haddin at the other end falls over and Hayden's caught in the middle of the pitch, but a wayward throw gets him a life...madness!
Tuffey to Hayden, 1 run there's the ton! Hayden drives a good length delivery towards mid-off and celebrates another ODI hundred! Its been a controlled innings from the big man

Gillespie to Hayden, no run fires on in from around the wicket, moving down leg, Hayden exposes the stumps as he looks to lap it fine, gets rapped on the back leg but the ball looked to have been carrying on down leg
Gillespie to Hayden, no run fires in another yorker well down leg stump, Hayden's backed away and as he looks to flick he cops another one on the foot and he's in pain
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run a low full toss on the legs is clipped square through midwicket out to Taylor on the ropes
Gillespie to Haddin, 1 run he heaves one across the line out to the man on the ropes, moving across from wide long-on, who saves four with a good stop
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run well done! A yorker on off stump, which he digs out to point
Gillespie to Haddin, no run halfvolley outside off stump, Haddin makes room and drives out to deep cover
Tuffey to Hayden, no run low full toss outside off stump, he swings across the line but cant beat mid-on
Tuffey to Hayden, 1 run full outside off stump, Hayden frees the arms but thats just one out to long-off
Tuffey to Haddin, FOUR runs full outside off stump, he too frees the arms but in this case, its a well-timed drive through the gap at cover-point for four
Tuffey to Haddin, OUT gone! Tuffey rolls the fingers over it, landing it on a good length outside off stump, Hayden drives across the line and finds Vincent stationed on the circle at mid-on
Tuffey to Hodge, no run good length ball on off stump, Hodge comes forward and defends to cover
Tuffey to Hodge, 1 run back of a length outside off stump, Hodge waits for it and steers it to backward point for a risky single
Patel to Hodge, no run back of a length outside off stump, Hodge initially comes forward and the waits for it, late-cutting between point and backward point, he sets off but hurries back in time
Patel to Hodge, 1 run well bowled, as he sees Hodge come down the track, fires it full and wide, and Hodge shuffles to flick into midwicket
Patel to Hayden, 1 run he uses the feet, Patel fires it full and fast, but Hayden has enough room to drive that down to long-off
Patel to Hodge, SIX runs oh ho! Patel tosses it up on a good length, Hodge comes down the track, gets to the pitch and smokes that handsomely over long-on for el sixo
Patel to Hodge, 1 run the full toss is worked into the off side for one
Patel to Hayden, 1 run tossed up on middle and leg, Hayden advances and chips over mid-on out to Tuffey moving in, but he cant get there in time
Styris to Hayden, SIX runs wow! Full on the legs, bread and butter, Hayden just whips that over deep backward square leg for half a dozen
Styris to Hayden, 1 run full outside off stump, he doesnt move his feet and just hammers that out to long-off
Styris to Hodge, 1 run good ball, yorker in the blockhole which he defends back to Styris
Styris to Hayden, 1 run back of a length outside off stump, he stands and pulls along the ground through squar leg for one
Styris to Hodge, 1 run fullish outside off stump, Hodge drives past mid-off for the single
Styris to Hayden, SIX runs bludgeoned! In the slot to be hit, and even a man on one leg can just free the arms and smoke that rows back over wide long-on, what a shot!
Patel to Hodge, 1 run good length on middle and off, driven out to long-on for one
Patel to Hayden, SIX runs jeez! Patel floats this up, Hayden stands and swings at it, golf-style, and even though he isn't to the pitch he hammers it over long-on for six
Patel to Hayden, SIX runs theres nothing in this pitch! Tossed up in the blockhole and Hayden repeats the last shot for a blistering six over long-on again
Patel to Hayden, 1 run fires in a low full toss on leg stump, which Hayden flicks out past square leg for one
Patel to Hodge, OUT bowled 'em neck and crop! Patel fires in one quicker as Hodge advances down the track, he's not to the pitch and the ball creeps in past the bat to shatter off and middle
Patel to Hussey, 1 run tossed up on middle and leg, worked past short fine leg for one to get off the mark immediately
Styris to Hussey, 1 run good length outside off stump, he leans into it and drives out to long-off
Styris to Hayden, FOUR runs back of a length outside off stump, he frees the arms and slaps that over Styris' head for four, hard hit that
Styris to Hayden, 1 run back of a length outside off stump, driven down to long-off for the single
Styris to Hussey, 2 runs straight on the stumps, he shuffles and works it in the gap behind square and calls for two immediately
Styris to Hussey, 1 run good length outside off stump, Hussey walks into it and places it in front of point for one
Styris to Hayden, no run good ball in the blockhole, a leaden-footed Hayden can only drive back to Styris
Patel to Hussey, 1 run fired in down leg, Hussey shuffles and works it past square leg for one
Patel to Hayden, 1 wide the first wide, and second extra, of the innings comes as Patel fires on well down leg stump
Patel to Hayden, 1 run fired in flat outside off stump, Hayden cant get the feet going and slams it down to long-off on the bounce
Patel to Hussey, 1 run good length on middle and leg, he uses the feet well to meet the ball and work it wide of mid-on
Patel to Hayden, no run fired in on middle and leg, spins into him as he makes room and he can only drive back to Patel
Patel to Hayden, SIX runs tossed up outside off stump, ends up a knee-high full toss, which Hayden disdainfully slams over long-on for half a dozen
Patel to Hayden, 1 run quicker and flatter, he drives out to long-off for one
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 bye the yorker ends up a low full toss down leg, he's made room and swings at it, misses and a bye is the call
Gillespie to Hussey, SIX runs Hussey joins in on the fun, coming down the track to a fullish delivery, making it fuller, and short-arm-punching it flat over long-on for six, shot!

Gillespie to Hussey, OUT this time he's gone! Hussey again dances down to a full delivery, but gets under and rolls the wrists on it, the ball takes the leading edge and the ball pops up high in the air for McCullum to call for it and safely pouch it
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run full outside off stump, driven down to long-off for one
Gillespie to White, no run good length outside off stump, White walks into it and places it in front of point but sends back Watson, the runner
Gillespie to White, no run full on the legs, White looks to flick square but ends up placing it more towards midwicket
Patel to Hayden, 1 run fired in full outside off stump, he swings across the line with one hand and gets it to mid-on
Patel to White, no run whats that now? White tries to club the cover off the ball but is beaten by the flight and pace, and McCullum fumbles the collection...wasnt a stumping, but still...
Patel to White, 1 run fired in again, on the stumps, he comes down but isnt to the pitch, works it to mid-on for one
Patel to Hayden, SIX runs hello dollie! Another full toss, he gets under it, doesnt time it at all but has enough bat on it to get six number eight over wide long-on
Patel to Hayden, 1 run smashed down to long-off, where Vincent is almost pushed back over the ropes by the velocity of that shot as he fields it...wuff
Patel to White, no run fired in quickly, White manages to jam the bat down on it, well bowled
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run bowled, in the blockhole, Hayden's confused as he swings at it and the ball takes the edge to the off side
Gillespie to White, SIX runs six for White! Lands on a back fo a length on the stump and he swings it away over deep midwicket for six of his own, oh boy, what next??
Gillespie to White, SIX runs even better! White tees-off and sends this dinger sailing miles over long-off and thats the 15th six of the innings so far, carnage!
Gillespie to White, OUT not this time! A bad ball but White cant send another full toss over deep midwicket as he finds Styris about three feet inside the wide long-on ropes
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run good length on middle and leg, worked past square leg for one
Gillespie to Voges, 1 run and he's off the mark first ball, driving a good length delivery from Gillespie down to long-off
Tuffey to Voges, 2 runs comes forward to a full delivery and works it wide of mid-on, they run hard and push for two and get it
Tuffey to Voges, 1 run good length delivery outside off stump, driven down to long-off for one
Tuffey to Hayden, 1 run good length outside off stump, he stands and drives down to long-off for one more and thats the highest score for an Aussie against New Zealand in one-day cricket
Tuffey to Voges, SIX runs oh, hello! What timing! Voges takes this from just outside off stump and sends it flat as a whistle over mid-on for his first ODI six
Tuffey to Voges, 1 run good length outside off stump, steered towards point for the single
Tuffey to Hayden, SIX runs make that nine sixes for Hayden! He clears the leg, backing away and making room to smote that very, very high over long-off for maximum over the sight screen
Gillespie to Voges, 1 run full delivery outside off stump, he gets the bat down and pushes into the covers
Gillespie to Hayden, FOUR runs full toss outside the off stump, again he just stands erect and drives in the gap on the off side and the ball races away to the ropes
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 leg bye this was in the slot to be creamed over the onside but Hayden's moved so far outside leg stump that he gets a leg bye off the front pad towards backward point
Gillespie to Voges, 1 run fullish outside off stump, Voges comes onto the frontfoot and chips this over point for one out to the sweeper

Gillespie to Hayden, (no ball) 1 run dropped! Hayden clips a full delivery on the legs out to McMillan on the deep midwicket ropes, but its in and out of his hands...and whats this? Its a no-ball...too much!
Gillespie to Voges, 1 run back of a length outside off stump, steered down to third man for one
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run strays down the pads again and Hayden flicks out to deep midwicket for one to keep strike last over
Tuffey to Hayden, SIX runs A one-handed six, would you believe it! What a small ground! Hayden gets under a low full toss and sends it over long-off for his tenth sixth, and thats ridiculous!
Tuffey to Hayden, 1 run good length outside off stump, chipped over cover for one
Tuffey to Voges, 1 run overpitched outside off stump, driven down to long-off
Tuffey to Hayden, 1 run full toss outside off stump, he swings a one-handed shot on that and will only get one to midwicket
Tuffey to Voges, 1 run fullish delivery outside off stump, Voges slogs that down to long-on to get Hayden back on strike for the final ball

Tuffey to Hayden, FOUR runs not six, but four! Hayden slams another one-handed shot smack down the ground over Tuffey's head for four, and ends up with the highest individual score for an Australian batsman in an ODI, and he carried his bat to boot!
Do join me again at around 18:30 local, 05:30 GMT for New Zealand's chase and Australia's attempt at avoiding a whitewash...or is it blackwash? I'll be back with all the action.

Hayden's good innings has carried Australia to 346. He was sluggish, had a couple close calls in the field, but smoked some super dingers and has batted all through the innings, despite injury to the foot, to take his side to a very competitive total. I was going to add another 'very' in there but then we've seen, in this series
Well, the players are all back about 20 minutes before schedule, as New Zealand were a little slow getting the overs in. Here's Nathan Bracken to Lou Vincent. One slip in place.
Bracken to Vincent, 1 wide bad ball to begin with, well wide down the leg side and its duly called so
Bracken to Vincent, 1 wide another wide as Bracken strives hard for swing and the ball moves away from Vincent's pads
Bracken to Vincent, no run pitches full on about middle and leg and swings too much down leg stump, rapped and they all go up in appeal but ball did too much
Bracken to Vincent, no run good stuff, lands outside off stump and curls into him as he raises the arms
Bracken to Vincent, 4 leg byes strays down the leg stump and Vincent looks to tickle it fine but ends up with four leg byes
Bracken to Vincent, no run back of a length outside off stump, Vincent walks into the shot but then has to check the shot to mid-off
Bracken to Vincent, 1 run short of a length outside off stump, Vincent walks into it and pushes it to mid-off for the first run off the bat
Bracken to Fleming, no run good length, swinging delivery outside off stump to which Fleming gets a foot forward and shoulders arms
Tait to Vincent, 1 wide and he too begins with a wide well down the leg side that Vincent cant get to with the attempted flick, work for Haddin early in the innings

Tait to Vincent, 1 run back of a length outside off stump, Vincent gets up and pushes into the cover for the quick single, he's lightfoot but Fleming's slower, in the end he makes it down the other end
Tait to Fleming, no run good length delivery outside off stump, Fleming drops the hands on the bat and thinks about the quick run but resists as cover swoops in
Tait to Fleming, no run good length delivery, he brings the back leg across off stump and then plonks the bat down on the ball to smother any late movement
Tait to Fleming, FOUR runs short and wide, and he wristily whips that over midwicket confidently for four, basically dragged that from outside off stump with a lot of bottom hand
Tait to Fleming, FOUR runs super shot! Fleming gets down on bended knee and square-drives the half-volley through point for four more
Tait to Fleming, no run better ball, on a good length on off stump and Fleming brings the angled bat down in a hurry to defend to the on side
Bracken to Vincent, no run fuller delivery, Vincent comes forward and plays with soft hands, thinking about the scampered single to mid-off
Bracken to Vincent, FOUR runs short and wide and he goes after it with a flash of the bat, and the thick edge flies past where second slip could've been and thats four
Bracken to Vincent, 1 run back of a length and moving into him, he stands and watches it under the eyeline, just dabbing it back past the stumps and calling for the run
Bracken to Fleming, no run good, moving ball lands outside off stump and swings into Fleming, who shoulders arms and lets it pass to Haddin
Bracken to Fleming, no run comes down the track and takes a good length delivery on the rise, square-cutting to backward point on the bounce
Bracken to Fleming, 1 run again he dances down the track but cant time this at all, hitting with one hand in front of mid-off and sneaking a single
Tait to Fleming, no run back of a length on off stump, he shuffles across and works that straight to midwicket
Tait to Taylor, no run and Tait welcomes him with a nice bouncer down the leg side, but Taylor just ducks under it
Tait to Taylor, FOUR runs shot! Good length delivery on middle and leg, Taylor gets over it and flicks it nicely in the gap at midwicket and gets off the mark with four on this racy outfield
Tait to Taylor, 1 run back of a length just outside off stump, he gets over it and taps it into the covers and wants the quick single, well run
Tait to Vincent, no run back of a length on and around off stump, he gets behind the line and defends back to Tait
Bracken to Taylor, no run back of a length on off stump, he walks into it and defends back to Bracken
Bracken to Taylor, no run back of a length again, this time he waits for it and pushes back to Bracken's left
Bracken to Taylor, no run overpitched outside off stump, he leans forward and drives back down the ground as Bracken collects it
Bracken to Taylor, 2 runs good length on leg stump, he flicks it around the corner past short fine leg for a brace
Bracken to Taylor, no run he chases a swinging half-volley outside off stump, 140ks, and gets beaten
Bracken to Taylor, no run back of a length outside off stump, Bracken knocks the bails off as he bowls, Taylor comes forward and defends
Tait to Vincent, no run back of a length on the stumps, he shuffles and works that down the ground to mid-on
Tait to Vincent, FOUR runs hoooo! Charges him, and flashes at at a short-pitched delivery and gets enough on it to carry it high over Haddin for four, but gets some words of advice from Tait!
Tait to Styris, no run back of a length on the stumps, he hops up and works that to short midwicket
Tait to Styris, no run fires in an attempted yorker at 155ks, its not entirely accurate but Styris somehow manages to get the bat down on it in time, well bowled
Tait to Styris, no run quick, back of a length delivery moving in from outside off stump, Styris hops to defend
Bracken to Taylor, 2 runs strays down leg stump, and Taylor whips this backward of square and wants two all the way through, and gets it with ease
Bracken to Taylor, 2 runs reaches forward to a good length delivery outside off stump and drives through the covers, Hussey gives chase and hauls it in
Bracken to Fulton, no run good length delivery on middle and leg, Fulton stands and works it to square leg
Bracken to Fulton, no run fuller one outside off stump, just, slower too on 120ks, Fulton gets a stride forward and defends
Bracken to Fulton, 1 run fullish one outside, Fulton gets off the mark with a drive into the covers where Hogg dives, rolls, and stops it in its tracks
Tait to Fulton, no run full on middle and leg, clipped to Johnson at short midwicket
Tait to Fulton, no run back of a good length on and around off stump, Fulton stands and drops the hands on it
Tait to Fulton, 1 run short of a length outside off stump, he opens the face of the bat and steers that down to third man for a single
Tait to Styris, no run good length outside off stump, he walks into a good-looking drive to mid-off
Tait to Styris, no run overpitched and he drives back to Tait, who takes it moving to his left
Tait to Styris, no run full on middle and leg, flicked to square leg
Bracken to Fulton, 1 wide bad ball, way down the leg side, wide called
Bracken to Fulton, no run good length outside off stump, he leans into it and drives to point
Bracken to Fulton, no run good length on the stumps, he hops and defends back to the bowler
Bracken to Fulton, no run overpitched on and around off stump, he drives to short midwicket
Bracken to Fulton, no run again he reaches for one outside off stump but cant time the drive at all, chopping into the ground in the covers
Bracken to Fulton, no run back of a length on off stump, he stands tall and works the wrists on it to place it to short midwicket
Bracken to Fulton, no run back of a length again, now he drives back down the ground and Bracken gets a hand on it, well bowled all over
Johnson to McMillan, no run lovely ball, sir! This one lands on a sweet spot and goes across him over the top of middle and off and beats him all ends up
Johnson to McMillan, 1 wide full and quite wide, McMillan chases it and is lucky not to get an edge
Johnson to McMillan, 1 run back of a length down leg stump, he hops and tucks it around the corner to short fine leg to get off the mark
Johnson to Fulton, no run short of a length outside off stump, Fulton gets up on the toes and steers it to backward point
Johnson to Fulton, 1 run good length on the stumps, gets up and defends to the bowler, ball runs past him for one
Johnson to McMillan, no run good length delivery moving across him and he shoulders arms

Bracken to Fulton, 1 run good length outside off stump, he eases into the drive to mid-off, Hodge collects the ball and fires in the throw on the nonstriker's stumps, and Fulton is just in....it helps to be a giant of a man
Bracken to McMillan, no run gives him the charge, taking a good length delivery outside off stump and slamming it to mid-on
Bracken to McMillan, FOUR runs a yorker on middle and off, and McMillan shuffles to flick it down to fine leg as he knew the man was up, neatly done
Bracken to McMillan, no run back of a length outside off stump, he gets up and drives to point with a 'WAIT' back to Fulton
Bracken to McMillan, no run down the wicket he comes, Bracken sees it and tucks him up, McMillan continues down leg and drives into the covers
Bracken to McMillan, no run beaten by one thats slanted past him off a length, Haddin takes it

Johnson to Fulton, SIX runs there's the first six of the New Zealand innings, and 18th of the match! Fulton swivels onto a short of a length delivery on off stump and hammers it over deep backward square leg to bring up the 50
Johnson to Fulton, FOUR runs this time he hops up to a short of a length ball on leg stump and tickles it around the gap past backward square for four
Johnson to Fulton, no run good length delivery just outside off stump, Fulton gets forward and defends
Johnson to Fulton, no run fuller one now, and he comes onto it and drives into the covers
Johnson to Fulton, 1 run short of a length outside off stump, he intentionally runs that down to third man for an easy single

Johnson to McMillan, FOUR runs bang, thats four! McMillan swings the bat at a full and wide delivery and creams it over backward point, the man on the ropes moving from third man had no chance to stop it
Watson to Fulton, 5 wide Watson begins with four wides down leg stump that even Haddin cant get to
Watson to Fulton, no run back of a length outside off stump, he plays away from his body and drives to point
Watson to Fulton, 1 run good length delivery down the leg side, Fulton goes on the backfoot and glances it to backward square leg
Watson to McMillan, no run good length outside off stump, he comes forward and defends to the off side
Watson to McMillan, 1 run good length delivery down leg, McMillan turns it to square leg
Watson to Fulton, no run fuller and slower, he comes forward and defends to the covers
Watson to Fulton, FOUR runs short of a length outside off stump, Fulton swings in the pull and gets an inside-edge past Haddin and down to fine leg for four
Johnson to McMillan, FOUR runs creamed over extra cover! McMillan gives this the kitchen sink and that was almost six, dont give him any room!
Johnson to McMillan, no run better ball, slower and almost in the blockhole, McMillan digs it out
Johnson to McMillan, no run good length and moving across him from off stump, he shoulders arms
Johnson to McMillan, 1 run strays down leg stump and he works it wide of square leg for a single
Johnson to Fulton, 1 run slower, back of a length delivery on leg stump, Fulton turns it to short fine leg
Johnson to McMillan, no run short of a length outside off stump, not enough room to cut, he ends up running it to point
Watson to Fulton, no run fuller ball on off stump, he comes on top of it and turns it to square leg
Watson to Fulton, no run good length outside off stump, Fulton's feet go nowhere as he drives down the ground, mid-on moves across and fields
Watson to Fulton, no run back of a length outside off stump, he gets back and drives to mid-off
Watson to Fulton, (no ball) 1 run short one, he gets into position to pull but doesnt time it well, it rolls into midwicket...its a no-ball to boot

Watson to McMillan, FOUR runs comes down the track and swings the bat a shorter one, gets an inside-edge that sneaks past leg stump, Haddin chases it to fine leg where Tait dives, and stops it, only for the 'keeper to kick it over the rope
Watson to McMillan, no run fuller one on and around off stump, McMillan comes on the frontfoot and defends it
Watson to McMillan, no run uses the feet again, backing away to leg, and he cant time his slog past point
Johnson to Fulton, no run back of a length outside off stump, Fulton drives to cover
Johnson to Fulton, SIX runs six! Fulton whips a rank half-volley on the legs just over deep backward square leg for half a dozen more..19 sixes and counting!
Johnson to Fulton, FOUR runs followed up with a four, as he reaches for a wide delivery and creams and it backward of point for four, well placed
Johnson to Fulton, FOUR runs and four more! Fulton's placement is spot-on, as he swivels on the hop to one moving down leg, and works it in the air over square leg
Johnson to Fulton, FOUR runs rubbish bowling, top shot! Johnson drops short on leg again and Fulton just swings it down to deep fine leg with a lovely drop-kick shovel shot
Johnson to Fulton, 1 run now he drives the rank half-volley into the covers, where a good diving stop from White saves four more
Watson to Fulton, FOUR runs overpitched, fractionally, and he chips this powerfully over mid-on for four, Fulton moves to 45!
Watson to Fulton, no run back of a length delivery outside off stump, he stands rooted and defends in front of point
Watson to Fulton, SIX runs you can chalk that down as the 20th six of the game, and thats Fulton's 50 in good time! He stands tall and hammers a good length ball smack over long-on for a huge six
Watson to Fulton, no run swivels on a shorter one and cops one in the stomach area, the ball rolls to the off side
Watson to McCullum, no run short and wide, he cuts aggressively, but cant beat backward point
Tait to McMillan, 1 wide full down leg side, he looks to flick and its called wide
Tait to McMillan, no run fraction short, he rocks back and cuts into the covers
Tait to McMillan, no run dragged one in short, McMillan pulls and the ball lands just in front of square leg
Tait to McMillan, no run good length delivery on middle and off, he opens the face and defends into the covers
Tait to McMillan, FOUR runs hah! McMillan gets six to his name as he flashes the bat at a 156k lifter and gets a top-edge for four
Tait to McMillan, 1 run slower one on a good length, he drops the bat down on it sets off
Tait to McCullum, no run good length delivery outside the off stump, McMillan opens the face of the bat and plays that to gully
Watson to McMillan, SIX runs there's McMillan's first, and the 20th of the match! Comes down the track and swings one over wide long-on for maximum
Watson to McMillan, no run good length outside off stump, he defends into the off side
Watson to McMillan, no run almost! Faster one moves in off a good length and catches McMillan outside leg stump, on the inner thigh
Watson to McMillan, FOUR runs drifts down leg stump, he shuffles and tickes it fine past short fine leg for four
Watson to McMillan, no run good length delivery on the stumps, McMillan comes on the frontfoot and plays it back to the bowler
Watson to McMillan, SIX runs big, bigger, biggest! McMillan uses the feet and slams this, base-ball style, miles over long-on for a huge one
Tait to McCullum, 1 run good length outside off stump, driven to mid-off
Tait to McMillan, no run full and moving well down leg stump, he looks for the flick to fine leg but mistimes it
Tait to McMillan, no run full toss on middle and off, driven to mid-on
Tait to McMillan, FOUR runs fuller one outside off stump, he plants the leg forward and swings it to mid-on, where Johnson misfields horribly and allows four
Tait to McMillan, FOUR runs banged in short, he swings on one leg and puts the long hop where it should go....all the way to deep fine leg for four
Tait to McMillan, no run good one! Now he gets some sense and fires in the yorker in the blockhole, which McMillan digs out well
Johnson to McCullum, no run good length, seaming delivery outside off stump, he judges it and shoulders arms
Johnson to McCullum, no run back of a length outside off stump, he gets behind it and defends to cover
Johnson to McCullum, no run well bowled! Pitches and moves off the seam to beat his tame backfoot prod, Haddin collects

Johnson to McCullum, 2 runs good length delivery, he comes forward and checks the shot, sets off for the quick single to mid-off, a throw from Hussey comes into Haddin's end, but where is he? He's gone off on a walk-about, as he expected the throw to go to the other end, and theres an extra run given away...shoddy stuff f
Johnson to McCullum, 1 run fuller outside off stump, McCullum reaches for it and slices it down to third man
Johnson to McMillan, no run well done, sir! The yorker in the blockhole, which the batsman digs out
Hogg to McCullum, no run looped up outside off stump, he comes forward and defends
Hogg to McCullum, no run flatter and quicker, he sweeps hard but gets rapped outside the line of off stump
Hogg to McCullum, 1 run pitches on middle and off and spins into him, he shuffles and picks up one to square leg
Hogg to McMillan, no run tossed up, he comes forward and plays at it outside off stump, misses the line
Hogg to McMillan, no run fizzing up outside off stump, he pokes at it and misses and Haddin cant collect it
Hogg to McMillan, FOUR runs smack, and thats his 50! Tossed up, he comes forward and hammers that past mid-off for four, well played!
Johnson to McCullum, no run good length outside off stump, McCullum walks forward and drives
Johnson to McCullum, 1 run full on the legs, clipped into midwicket for one
Johnson to McMillan, 1 run overpitched on off stump, he leans into it and drives out to mid-off for one
Johnson to McCullum, 2 runs quick and full on leg stump, he flicks and gets a leading edge over backward point out to third man
Johnson to McCullum, 2 runs too full outside off stump, he latches onto a firm drive but a good diving save by White at cover saves the boundary
Johnson to McCullum, 1 run back of a length down leg stump, easy pickings for McCullum, who tickles it fine for the single
Hogg to McCullum, FOUR runs short and wide, he rocks back and pulls through square leg and the placement is superb, four runs
Hogg to McCullum, 1 run tossed up outside off stump, he leans forward and defends to cover
Hogg to McMillan, no run tossed up on the stumps, he plans the leg forward and defends
Hogg to McMillan, no run flatter trajectory, he comes half-forward and defends
Hogg to McMillan, no run tossed up, he comes forward and turns it to leg, good bowling this
Hogg to McMillan, 1 run too full, he gets down and sweeps past square leg for one
Johnson to McMillan, FOUR runs overpitched, and he creams it over cover-point for four, and the fun continues
Johnson to McMillan, 1 run good length delivery outside off stump, he leans into it and drives down towards long-off
Johnson to McCullum, no run beaten by one that angles across him from a good length, he plays at it and gets comprehensively beaten
Johnson to McCullum, 1 run fuller, he meets it with good footwork and squeezes it to Voges at point, they just manage to pinch the risky single

Johnson to McMillan, FOUR runs oh well played! This one was quick and full outside off stump and McMillan jammed the bat down it, deflecting it in the gap behind point and the speedy outfield carries it to the boundary
Johnson to McMillan, 1 run strays onto middle and leg and McMillan tucks it around the corner for one to end a productive over for New Zealand, who've maintained the run rate at the halfway stage
Hogg to McMillan, 1 run tossed up outside off stump, swept away out to the deep for one
Hogg to McCullum, 1 run flatter outside leg stump, McCullum shuffles away and works it around to Johnson at short fine leg
Hogg to McMillan, 1 run looped up outside off stump, he comes forward and drives wide of point
Hogg to McCullum, 1 run tossed up outside off stump again, and he sweeps in the air in front of square out to Johnson in the deep
Hogg to McMillan, 1 run pitches on middle and leg and he reverse-sweeps down to third man for one
Hogg to McCullum, no run quicker and shorter, comes onto McCullum quicker than anticipated, he shuffles and drives to the on side
Voges to McMillan, 1 run tossed up, driven down to long-off for one
Voges to McCullum, 1 run fired into middle and leg, comes forward and works it to square leg for the single
Voges to McMillan, 1 run tossed up, McMillan dances down the track and flat-bats it down to long-off
Voges to McCullum, no run fired into middle and leg and McCullum defends back to Voges
Voges to McCullum, 1 run tossed up, he uses the feet to drive into the covers
Voges to McMillan, SIX runs six No. 22! McMillan gives himself room, clearing the front leg, and biffs that with sheer bottom-hand power for another clanger over the sight screen! Top shot!
Hogg to McCullum, 1 run quicker one, well bowled, McCullum shuffles to off stump and defends to midwicket
Hogg to McMillan, 1 run slower one on a length, he waits for it and then paddles it into square leg for an easy run
Hogg to McCullum, no run tossed up, comes well forward and defends and sends his partner back as cover swoops in
Hogg to McCullum, 1 run tossed up, he plants the front leg in line of the ball and sweeps behind square for another single
Hogg to McMillan, 1 run this one spins in off a good length as the batsman stands erect, and chops it into the ground, some bounce on that ball too
Hogg to McCullum, no run this one spins a mile from outside off stump and McCullum has to withdraw the bat as he thought about chasing it, good bowling from Hogg
Voges to McMillan, no run good one, full and fast into leg stump and he defends back to Voges
Voges to McMillan, 1 run fired in again, he uses the feet and drives out to long-on
Voges to McCullum, 1 run tossed up, he gets a stride forward and brings up the 200 with a steered single to point
Voges to McMillan, 2 runs tossed up again, McMillan gets forward and times the drive in the gap on the off side and picks up a couple
Voges to McMillan, FOUR runs smashed! A full toss outside off stump, he uses the feet well and hits it through the covers for four
Voges to McMillan, 1 run looped up down leg stump, he easily works that behind square for one and another good over for the hosts comes to an end
Hogg to McMillan, 1 run tossed up outside off stump, he uses the feet well to get to the pitch and drive into the covers for one
Hogg to McCullum, 1 run looped up on off stump, he gets a good stride forward and sweeps through square leg for one
Hogg to McMillan, 1 run flatter on middle and leg, he shuffles and works it fine for one more
Hogg to McCullum, no run good, looping delivery outside off stump, gets a good step forward and defends into the covers
Hogg to McCullum, 1 run shorter and he cracks that out to the covers for one
Hogg to McMillan, 1 run
Voges to McMillan, no run fired in on middle and leg, he drives back to Voges
Voges to McMillan, SIX runs I'm counting each one for you, and thats 23 sixes today! What a hit on this small ground! McMillian sashays down the track and clubs that over long-on for a big six!

Voges to McMillan, SIX runs HOLY CRAP, thats out of the stadium! Superb hitting, its like a baseball home run derby! McMillan dances down and lifts Voges miles over the sight screen....24 sixes in the game and McMillan celebrates his 100 with a fiesty pump of the first....immense innings!
Voges to McMillan, 1 run tossed up, McMillan comes on the frontfoot and drives it to cover
Voges to McCullum, 1 run looped up down the leg side, McCullum goes on the backfoot and glances it to short fine leg
Voges to McMillan, no run full outside off stump, he leans forward and drives to White at cover
Hogg to McCullum, no run tossed up, he comes forward and drives to cover
Hogg to McCullum, 1 run looped up down the leg side, McCullum glances it to short fine leg
Hogg to McMillan, 1 run drifts to leg and he works it to midwicket for one more
Hogg to McCullum, FOUR runs flat down the legs, and he just laps it around the corner and the outfield does the rest
Hogg to McCullum, no run tossed up, he comes forward in defence
Hogg to McCullum, 1 run quicker and flatter, he shuffles and nudges it to square leg
Tait to McCullum, 1 run good length ball on off stump, he comes forward with bat and bad married and pushes to mid-off
Tait to McMillan, 1 run overpitched outside off stump and he square-drives past point out to the sweeper
Tait to McCullum, 1 run fuller one on off stump, he lunges forward and defends and the inside-edge sneaks to square leg
Tait to McMillan, 5 wide too full down the leg side and he easily clips that past a diving Haddin for four....wides are the call in the end
Tait to McMillan, no run good response! A rising delivery over the stumps and McCullum arches the back to sway out of the way, good cricket!
Tait to McMillan, no run good length delivery around off stump, McCullum gets half-forward and drives back to Tait
Tait to McMillan, no run good ball, pitches full on middle and leg and moves into him, he cant work it fine
Hogg to McCullum, no run tossed up, he comes forward and defends to the on side
Hogg to McCullum, 1 run spins into him from outside off stump, he rocks back and cuts uppishly to backward point
Hogg to McMillan, 1 run pitches outside leg stump and he works it around the corner for one

Hogg to McCullum, no run looped up outside off stump, McCullum comes forward and defends to the off side, calls for the run, then sends McMillan back, and he has to turn quickly and dive, and his bat was just inside the line....tense!
Hogg to McCullum, 5 wide wide down the leg stump, spins outside and carries on, Hogg's quicker one goes awry and beats Haddin too
Hogg to McCullum, 1 run looped up on off stump, he comes forward and defends,pinching a run in front of point
Hogg to McMillan, no run spins away from outside off stump and McMillan stands and chases it, only to get beaten
Tait to McCullum, no run bounced down the leg side and McCullum ducks under it, 153ks on that delivery, good stuff
Tait to McCullum, 1 run short and wide, he cuts hard and the edge goes fine to third man, the 250 comes up
Tait to McMillan, no run another good lifter outside off stump, McMillan gets out of harm's way, you cannot play those!
Tait to McMillan, 1 run full this time, and he drives past the covers out to the sweeper for one
Tait to McCullum, no run bounced over leg stump, and thats a crucial dot ball for Australia, intelligent bowling from Tait
Tait to McCullum, no run full again, McCullum mistimes the ondrive to mid-on
Watson to McMillan, 1 run good length outside off stump, he comes forward and defends to point
Watson to McCullum, 1 run overpitched and he drives nicely to Bracken at mid-off, good shot for one
Watson to McMillan, no run bounced on top of middle and off and he sways the back out of the way
Watson to McMillan, 1 run now he comes back down the track and collects the good length ball on the full, driving down to long-on
Watson to McCullum, no run another bouncer over leg stump, McCullum gets down onto his haunches
Watson to McCullum, 1 run moves in off a good length, he takes one hand off the bat and runs it down to third man
Bracken to McCullum, no run good length ball on the stumps, the batsman hops and defends compactly
Bracken to McCullum, 1 run good length again, he defends off the back foot and picks up one to cover
Bracken to McMillan, no run width offered, but he steers this to point
Bracken to McMillan, no run good length outside off stump, comes forward and defends to the covers
Bracken to McMillan, no run full outside off stump, he drives hard to White at extra cover, who fumbles the collection
Bracken to McMillan, 1 run overpitched and this time he drives past White and gets one
Watson to McMillan, FOUR runs begins with a short one, angled down leg stump with little bounce, McMillan swivels on one leg and pulls the long hop to fine leg
Watson to McMillan, 1 run good length ball moves in from outside off stump, he defends and McCullum sprints down calling the run and they get it
Watson to McCullum, no run shorter one this time, not enough room to free the arms, he chops it in front of backward point
Watson to McCullum, no run back of a length on off stump, he gets behind the line and defends with a 'WAIT THERE, MACCA!'
Watson to McCullum, no run back of a length again, he hops and pushes into the covers off the back foot
Watson to McCullum, no run good length ball outside off stump, he comes forward and defends into the covers and sends McMillan back
Bracken to McMillan, 1 run overpitched, McMillan gets to the pitch and drives past the covers
Bracken to McCullum, 1 run good length again, and he gets to the pitch and drives into the point region
Bracken to McMillan, no run full and wide, he swings at it and misses, Haddin whips off the bails
Bracken to McMillan, no run back of a length on off stump, steered to point and he sends his partner back, very good bowling
Bracken to McMillan, no run bowled! Slower one moves into him, and he has to defend back to Bracken
Bracken to McMillan, 1 run full toss which he drives down to long-on, just three singles from the over
Watson to McMillan, no run good length ball on and around off stump, he gets to the pitch and defends to mid-off
Watson to McMillan, 1 run banged in short and McMillan pulls in the air over square leg and the ball lands safely in front of the man at deep midwicket, and thats the 150 stand from 135 balls
Watson to McCullum, FOUR runs now he can pull! McCullum gets over another short one and pulls, off one leg, past fine leg and that ball fairly raced away
Watson to McCullum, 2 runs good length ball outside off stump, he eases into a drive through the off side and gets a couple more to his name
Watson to McCullum, no run good length ball on the stumps, gets pad and bat together and defends
Watson to McCullum, 1 run back of a length, slower one, comes in and he plays it with soft hands to point for one
Johnson to McCullum, no run good length delivery on off stump, he comes forward and defends and sends his partner back
Johnson to McCullum, 1 run back of a length on leg stump, McCullum works it to square leg to bring up his 50 and Seddon Park erupts
Johnson to McMillan, 1 run hoooo! Full and wide, McMillan closes his eyes and slashes this over backward point, the ball spirals up and lands just a pace in front of third man
Johnson to McCullum, FOUR runs pumped! A fraction full and wide, McCullum clears the front leg and biffs that over mid-off for a one-bounce four
Johnson to McCullum, no run fuller again, angled past him and he has a tickle at it, but the edge falls in front of Haddin, was a slower delivery, so....
Johnson to McCullum, 1 run overpitched, McCullum leans into a drive past cover-point for one out to the sweeper
Watson to McCullum, 1 run fraction wide, and slower, he waits for it and the runs it wide of Haddin down to third man for the single
Watson to Franklin, 1 run back of a length on off stump, he stands and defends and escapes with an inside-edge past square leg
Watson to McCullum, 1 run good length outside off stump, he plays nice and straight and picks up one into the covers
Watson to Franklin, no run bounced over the top of middle and leg, he ducks under it
Watson to Franklin, 1 run fraction short and he places that with soft hands into the gap in front of point
Johnson to Franklin, 1 wide wide ball, down the leg side
Johnson to Franklin, no run good length ball outside off stump, no room on offer, Franklin comes forward and defends to point
Johnson to Tuffey, 1 run good length delivery outside off stump, he doesnt get to the pitch but drives to mid-off for a quick single
Johnson to McCullum, 1 run good length on off stump, he drives back past the stumps to long-off
Johnson to Tuffey, no run overpitched outside off stump, Tuffey stands rooted and drives, only to get beaten
Johnson to Tuffey, no run edged and it doesnt carry! Tuffey comes forward and drives at a moving delivery outside off stump, and the edge bounces in front of White at slip
Watson to McCullum, no run beaten by one that moves a shade outside off stump, no footwork, just a tame flirt outside off stump
Watson to McCullum, 1 run full again, now he gets over it and opens the face, running it to point for the quick single
Watson to Tuffey, 1 run back of a length outside off stump, he stands and drives down to mid-off
Watson to McCullum, 1 run back of a length outside off stump, stands and glides that wide of point for another quick single
Watson to Tuffey, 2 runs stands and flashes the bat at it, looking to clear the infield, and he does, just, as it lands safely over mid-off's head
Watson to Tuffey, FOUR runs crucial runs! Tuffey flashes the bat at a wide one and the thick edge runs down to third man on one bounce
Johnson to McCullum, no run back of a length on off stump, he gets behind the line and presents the full face of the bat back to the bowler
Johnson to McCullum, SIX runs wow! This man is not bothered too much, as he makes room for himself and blasts this back down the ground for six over the sight screen
Johnson to McCullum, 1 run now here's the cool single, as he comes forward to a good length delivery and pushes in front of point
Johnson to Tuffey, no run now he too has a free swing of the arms but his timing isnt as good as McCullum, and he makes zero contact...reverse swing...?
Johnson to Gillespie, no run back of a length delivery, Gillespie looks to run it down but misses
Watson to McCullum, 1 run lands on a good length, he comes forward and drives to mid-off
Watson to Gillespie, 2 runs dropped in short on middle and off, he pulls in the gap at midwicket and they scramble two
Watson to Gillespie, 2 runs well bowled! This was slow on a good length just outside off stump, the leg cutter, Gillespie stands and pokes at it and gets an inside-edge past Haddin for two more
Watson to Gillespie, FOUR runs the attempted yorker goes awry, ends up a full toss on middle and off, Gillespie stands and pokes at it with an angled bat and the edge races past Haddin for four
Watson to Gillespie, 2 runs runs again! Short of a length delivery on middle and leg, he swings it and gets a french cut off the inner edge of the bat past Haddin again
Watson to Gillespie, FOUR runs SHOT! Gillespie! Stand and delivery slog all along the ground past mid-off, just slapped, and McCullum looks at Gillespie with a smile
Tait to McCullum, 2 runs biffed! Full and straight, McCullum clears the leg and drives straight down the ground, long-off and long-on converge but the batsmen get two anyways, great running
Tait to McCullum, 1 run overpitched outside off stump, room on offer, McCullum hits that very hard down to Hogg at long-off, who gets down and fields well
Tait to Gillespie, FOUR runs Gillespie you beauty! This one is full and moving into leg stump, Gillespie backs away and squirts the bat at it, and gets another four courtesy the french cut
Tait to Gillespie, 2 runs fast and full, speared into leg stump, he shuffles and nudges it into the gap at midwicket and thats some terrific running
Tait to Gillespie, 1 run attempted yorker on off stump, he makes room and exposes the stumps, and then jams the bat down to steer it down to third man...Gillespie!
Tait to McCullum, 1 run overpitched outside off stump, McCullum leans into it and drives out to cover sweeper for the single...Seddon Park is alive
Bracken to McCullum, no run good ball! Zeroed in on middle and off and McCullum can only dig it out back to Bracken...well bowled
Bracken to McCullum, 1 run full on middle and leg, he uses the feet to flick to mid-on for one...he sure trusts Gillespie
Bracken to Gillespie, 2 runs full on middle and leg, and he plays a very good-looking flick, proper roll of the wrists et al, and gets an easy two out to deep midwicket
Bracken to Gillespie, 2 runs slower ball on off stump, now he's just messing with all of us is Gillespie, as he gets over it and flicks over square leg for a couple more
Bracken to Gillespie, no run good ball again, well done, great length outside off stump and it beats Gillespie's attempted slash
Bracken to Gillespie, 2 runs yorker goes wrong again, ends up full, and Gillespie flicks wide of square leg, wants two, a good throw comes in but Gillespie is home safe
Tait to McCullum, no run full and wide, he crunches a hard drive to cover
Tait to McCullum, 1 run good ball, in the blockhole, McCullum hammers it wide of mid-on for a quick single
Tait to Gillespie, 1 run short of a length, a bouncer, but Gillespie gets up on the toes and runs that in the gap at gully for one down to third man
Tait to McCullum, 1 run full and wide, he makes room and square-drives past backward point, thought about the second but thinks better

Tait to Gillespie, OUT run out! Tait bowls a great, low delivery outside off stump, Gillespie squeezes the bat down it to steer it to backward point, crosses for one and then as he turns for the second, has to head back as a very good throw comes in from Voges to get him inches short of his crease
Tait to McCullum, 1 run full in the blockhole, McCullum looks to club it, mistimes it to the off side, sets off, Tait and cover swoop in and fire a throw but McCullum is safe
Bracken to McCullum, SIX runs would you believe it? Bracken! He bowls a knee-high full toss on the stumps and McCullum slams that superbly over deep fine leg for half a dozen! What a game this is!
Bracken to McCullum, no run full and he drives that back to the bowler

Bracken to McCullum, FOUR runs thats four, and New Zealand have whitewashed, blackwashed, whatever you wanna call it - they've beaten Australia 3-0! McCullum slashes another low full toss, one-handed, smack in the gap behind backward point and since everyone was up, that ball was destined for the ropes!

Well, thats all we have for you. This was the last official ODI ahead of that little tournament the ICC have lined up next month. We will definitely see you there. This is Jamie Alter signing off with a hearty cheers until the World Cup!
So New Zealand sweep the 2006-07 Chappell-Hadlee Series.
For those interested in stats, today's match had 26 sixes - yes, 26 - to equal the record set during that 438 match at Johannesburg last year.

Spare a though for Mike Hussey, who hasnt won a game as captain. He had a depleted side, but then like they say, you put your best team forward. New Zealand too were without their two best bowlers, Shane Bond and Daniel Vettori, and it showed as Matthew Hayden led a fine onslaught to carry Australia to 346. He carried his bat, a

McMillan....well, he needs a special mention. From 41 for 4, with the solid Peter Fulton for support to begin with, he slammed the fastest ODI hundred by a New Zealander. He showed his belligerence in the CB Series and in the last match, but today he took it up a notch and then some. A fabulous innings from him, a day he wont fo

I need a breather and a nice stiff drink. Wow. If you thought the last match was a humdinger, well I'll tell you, this was something else. Bracken just lost the plot in the last over, offering a bleeding full toss to McCullum, a man whose reputation as a last-ditch scrapper has skyrocketed. What an innings he played, an unbeaten
New Zealand won by 1 wicket (with 3 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Matthew Hayden, AUS
